New Records: Aaron Nola tied Cole Hamels for the most wins at Citizens Bank Park, reaching 56 wins there.
Nola moved into seventh place on the franchise's career wins list with 102 wins.
Key Match Events: Aaron Nola tossed seven shutout innings, allowing four hits.
Nick Castellanos hit a three-run homer for a 4-0 lead.
The Phillies won 5-0, their fourth straight win.
Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies had improved their performance recently, winning their last two games before the series.
They were leading the NL East with a six-game advantage.
Post-Match Reflections: Nola received a standing ovation and praised the achievement of tying with franchise greats.
Astros manager Joe Espada noted Verlander's strong performance despite some issues in the third inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Verlander, at 41, was the oldest active pitcher and remained key for the Astros' AL West chase.
Phillies had a franchise-record 30 straight wins when the starter went deep.
